intro: Thamnochortus lucens, commonly known as the yellow star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and a central disk of smaller flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Thamnochortus lucens is known for its compact, bushy growth habit and its ability to thrive in full sun. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
